body:
On the 14th of February, while the world celebrates la Saint Valentin, Tunisia celebrates la Saint-Révolution. On this day, the Tunisian revolution is one month old. On the 14th of January, Tunisians were not able to properly celebrate the departure of the dictator because of the state of emergency, the curfew and the acts of violence carried out by loyalists to Ben Ali. So, the day is considered as a second opportunity for Tunisians to celebrate the revolution and their love for their country.
Plenty of events are planned for the occasion by govenment officials, non-political organisation as well as young Tunisna bloggers.
The sector of tourism was negatively affected by the revolution.To[caption id="attachment_195870" align="alignleft" width="375" caption="The logo of the campaign \"Tunisie admirez-la de près\""][/caption] reduce the amout of damage and attract tourists back to the country the office for tourism  has launched a campaign named in French :"Tunisie admirez-la de près"   Admire Tunisia closely
Two young Tunisian Facebookers  Achraf Aouadi and  Sawssen Bl created on Facebook" 14 Février on va célébrer la Saint-Révolution", an event which will take place on Hbib Bourguiba Avenue, in the capital Tunis.
The number of those who pledged to participate is amounted at twelve thousand people and the number is likely to rise.

On the 14th of February, while the world celebrates la Saint Valentin, Tunisia celebrates la Saint-Révolution. On this day, the Tunisian revolution is one month old. On the 14th of January, Tunisians were not able to properly celebrate the departure of the dictator because of the state of emergency, the curfew and the acts of violence carried out by loyalists to Ben Ali. So, the day is considered as a second opportunity for Tunisians to celebrate the revolution and their love for their country. Plenty of events are planned for the occasion by govenment officials, non-political organisation as well as young Tunisna bloggers. The sector of tourism was negatively affected by the revolution.To[caption id="attachment_195870" align="alignleft" width="375" caption="The logo of the campaign \"Tunisie admirez-la de près\""][/caption] reduce the amout of damage and attract tourists back to the country the office for tourism has launched a campaign named in French :"Tunisie admirez-la de près"
Admire Tunisia closely
Two young Tunisian Facebookers Achraf Aouadi and Sawssen Bl created on Facebook" 14 Février on va célébrer la Saint-Révolution", an event which will take place on Hbib Bourguiba Avenue, in the capital Tunis. The number of those who pledged to participate is amounted at twelve thousand people and the number is likely to rise.
title: Tunisians celebrate la Saint-Révolution

sentence: On the 14th of February, while the world celebrates la Saint Valentin, Tunisia celebrates la Saint-Révolution.
On this day, the Tunisian revolution is one month old.

On the 14th of January, Tunisians were not able to properly celebrate the departure of the dictator because of the state of emergency, the curfew and the acts of violence carried out by loyalists to Ben Ali.
So, the day is considered as a second opportunity for Tunisians to celebrate the revolution and their love for their country.
Plenty of events are planned for the occasion by govenment officials, non-political organisation as well as young Tunisna bloggers.

The sector of tourism was negatively affected by the revolution.To[caption id="attachment_195870" align="alignleft" width="375" caption="The logo of the campaign \"Tunisie admirez-la de près\""][/caption] reduce the amout of damage and attract tourists back to the country the office for tourism  has launched a campaign named in French :"Tunisie admirez-la de près"   Admire Tunisia closely
Two young Tunisian Facebookers  Achraf Aouadi and  Sawssen Bl created on Facebook" 14 Février on va célébrer la Saint-Révolution", an event which will take place on Hbib Bourguiba Avenue, in the capital Tunis.
The number of those who pledged to participate is amounted at twelve thousand people and the number is likely to rise.
